Description: A hollow terracotta phoenix seated on a lotus-seed head; solar disc on its head; uncertain object below the chest, probably a lump of myrrh. On an oval plinth. The back has minimal details, and the tip of the beak is lost. Two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt with a little mica; dark-brown surface.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in Akhmim (Panopolis). Roman, probably second century AD. Comparanda: Not unlike: Petrie Museum uc48110 and uc48344, both from Memphis.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3721)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
